thread.title: Early Freeze is Good News for Ice Rinks
thread.title_full: Early Freeze is Good News for Ice Rinks

author: Door County Pulse
title: Early Freeze is Good News for Ice Rinks
text:
Early Freeze is Good News for Ice Rinks
The December cold snap is a welcome change for at least some outdoor enthusiasts.
The cold temperatures brought early openings for the Teresa K. Hilander Community Ice Rink in Sister Bay and the Sturgeon Bay Ice Rink at Memorial Field. The rinks will be open as long as temperatures allow.
Teresa K. Hilander Community Ice Rink
Autumn Court, Sister Bay
Monday through Friday, 4 to 8 pm; Saturday, 10 am to 8 pm; Sunday, 12 to 8 pm
In Sister Bay, youâ€™ll find both a recreational rink and a rink with nets and goals for hockey, pond hockey and broomball.
Guests can rent skates, sticks and broomball shoes for kids and adults, grab snacks and hot chocolate in the warming house, and warm up around the big fire pit outside.
Check ice conditions at facebook.com/sisterbayicerink.
The Northern Door Broomball League is accepting teams for the 2026 season. The league plays on Wednesday nights beginning Jan. 7, weather permitting. Contact [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) for more information.
City of Sturgeon Bay Ice Rink
307 S. 14th Ave. in Sturgeon Bay, across from Sunrise Elementary School
Monday through Friday, 4 to 8 pm; Saturday and Sunday, 12 to 8 pm
Skates are available to rent and skate sharpening is offered as well.
For updates on conditions, check facebook.com/cityofsturgeonbay.
